data.title: Mean Girls: Why a nearly 20-year-old movie is trending in 2023
data.meta_description: Why Mean Girls is making buzz this week: from Walmart ad reunion to new movie musical.
data.text:
Lindsay Lohan and other cast members reunite for Walmart ad

Gretchen Wieners may not have been able to make her iconic “fetch” catchphrase “happen”, but Mean Girls continues to stay relevant.

It’s been almost 20 years since the 2004 teen comedy movie was released, but Mean Girls is as popular as ever.

Not only can teens (the film is rated PG-13) watch the original film, there are also new ways to experience the story, including an upcoming new film and a Broadway musical.

Plus, a recent surprise reunion… of sorts.

Here are three reasons Mean Girls is trending in 2023.

1. The original Mean Girls cast reunited for a Walmart ad

Some of the cast of the Mean Girls movie from 2004 have reunited in an ad for Walmart.

The two-minute advertisement appeared on YouTube on Nov. 1 and promotes retail giant Walmart’s Black Friday sale.

In the ad, Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried and Lacey Chabert reprise their roles, but this time as grown-up versions.

The ad casts Lohan’s Cady Heron as the high school guidance counselor, Seyfried’s Karen Smith as a weather reporter and Chabert’s Gretchen Wieners as a mom to a teenage girl.

The script adapts classic scenes and quotes from the movie to promote Walmart and its products.

Another surprise cameo was hip-hop artist Missy Elliott as the high school coach.

Notably absent was Canadian actor Rachel McAdams, who played head mean girl Regina George in the 2004 movie.

2. A stage musical based on the movie is touring parts of Canada

A musical version of the movie debuted on Broadway in New York City in 2018.

WATCH — HSMTMTS stars Joshua Bassett, Sofia Wylie on final season

Since then, the stage show has gone on tour, including in parts of Canada.

In January 2024, it will be coming to Edmonton, Calgary and Vancouver.

The musical script was written by actor and comedian Tina Fey, who co-wrote the 2004 film. It was largely based on the 2002 book Queen Bees and Wannabes by Rosalind Wiseman.

3. Renée Rapp is starring in 2024 movie version of the musical set to premiere in January

A movie adaptation of the musical is set to be released in theatres on Jan. 12, 2024.

WATCH — Matilda musical's Emma Thompson and Alisha Weir spread cheer and fear

Pop singer and actor Renée Rapp stars as Regina George. Rapp originally played Regina on Broadway back in 2019.

In addition to adding in musical numbers, the movie will feature updates and changes from the original film.

Two 2004 cast members will be returning.

Fey will return as Ms. Norbury. She will be joined by fellow Saturday Night Live alumni Tim Meadows, who returns to play principal Duvall.
